intro: Chaenopleura, commonly known as the false holly or silverleaf holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs characterized by their evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically leathery and glossy, with a distinctive silver or grayish underside. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in acidic, well-drained soils.
